context_of_use: This use case describes the process by which a doctor can automatically send prescriptions to pharmacy information systems.
description: Automatically send prescriptions from the hospital system to external pharmacy information systems.
triggering_event: The doctor initiates the transfer of prescriptions.
preconditions: The doctor is logged into the hospital management system.
The prescription is ready to be transferred.
postconditions: The prescription is successfully sent to the pharmacy information system.
assumptions: The hospital management system has the capability to connect with external pharmacy information systems.
The doctor has the necessary permissions to transfer prescriptions.
requirements_met: The system shall allow doctors to transfer prescriptions to pharmacy information systems.
The system shall ensure that prescriptions are processed efficiently.
outstanding_issues: Clarification on the types of pharmacy information systems supported.
main_flow: 1. Doctor initiates the transfer of prescriptions → System prepares the prescription data for transfer.
2. Doctor confirms the transfer → System sends the prescription to the pharmacy information system.
3. System receives confirmation of successful transfer → System updates the prescription status.
